intro: Isertia haenkeana var. haenkeana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a perennial herb with erect, branched stems and lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, or white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
